title: Insurance Analyst Found Mission in Visits to Death Row
sub_head: Thomas G. Rosencrants, who has died at age 72, befriended inmates at a Louisiana penitentiary
body:
Thomas G. Rosencrants, who grew up in Jackson, Mich., as the son of a postal clerk, felt an early vocation to become a Roman Catholic priest but gave up that plan and studied philosophy instead at the University of Dayton.
He veered into finance after finding work as an underwriter at Prudential Insurance Co. in Chicago. He later made a name for himself as a frequently quoted insurance-industry investment analyst at William Blair & Co., Conning & Co., Interstate/Johnson Lane Inc. and Robinson-Humphrey Co. A resident of Atlanta, he also ran a company providing software for insurers and headed a private-equity firm.
